habitat: Lawns, meadows, grassy areas, fairy rings, summer to fall, North America, South America, Europe, Asia, Africa, Australia.
shortDescription: Poisonous mushroom with white cap turning scaly, green spores, causes gastrointestinal distress.
benefitsOrToxicity: Causes nausea, vomiting, diarrhea 1-3 hours after ingestion, non-lethal but may require hospital treatment.

identification.cap: 10-35 cm, convex to flat, smooth then brown to pinkish-brown scales.
identification.gills: Free or attached, white to grayish-green or brownish-green.
identification.stem: 8-20 cm, 1.5-3 cm thick, tapering top, white to brown, persistent white ring with greenish lower edge.
identification.microscopicFeatures: Spores 9-13 x 6-9 µm, amygdaliform to ellipsoid, smooth, small pore; cheilocystidia 40-55 x 10-15 µm, cylindric to subclavate; pileipellis trichoderm or cutis.

note: Common in lawns, fairy rings, poisonous to pets too.
